parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions Călin Georgescu, who participated in the presidential elections.  While not directly advocating for or against him, the post's framing clearly refers to him and his electoral performance.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The question posed ("Voi ce opinie aveți?") is an open invitation for public engagement, further supporting this conclusion.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While not explicitly urging voters to support or reject Călin Georgescu, the post's framing of his electoral performance as either "manipulare" or a "vot de protest" subtly influences public perception. This framing could indirectly impact voters' opinions and choices. The ambiguity is a key factor here; it walks a fine line.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post presents information about Călin Georgescu's electoral results. However, the framing of this information as either manipulation or protest is subjective and opinionated, blurring the line between objective journalism and opinion-based commentary intended to influence public perception.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Partially True. The post presents a question, inviting personal opinions. However, the leading questions ("manipulare de proporții" or "vot de protest") strongly suggest a pre-determined narrative, potentially influencing the responses and shaping public opinion.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1589127498477281</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while not explicitly endorsing or opposing Călin Georgescu, presents his electoral performance within a biased framework. The leading questions ("manipulare de proporții" or "vot de protest") aim to shape public perception, potentially influencing voters' opinions.  The post's paid nature and wide reach on a public platform further strengthen the argument that it constitutes electoral propaganda.  While it doesn't directly advocate for or against a candidate, the indirect influence is significant.  The ambiguity of the post's message is a key factor, making it a borderline case.  However, given the principle "in dubio pro reo," the benefit of the doubt should be given to the accused.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>Călin Georgescu</name>
    <impact>NEGATIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>SC INDISCRET MEDIA SRL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
SC INDISCRET MEDIA SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea pe Facebook, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări plătite (ID 1589127498477281) care, deși nu susține explicit un candidat, prezintă rezultatele electorale ale lui Călin Georgescu într-un cadru tendențios, sugerând manipulare sau vot de protest prin întrebări capcană precum „Asistăm la o manipulare de proporții sau voturile primite de Călin Georgescu sunt doar o reacție a unei părți a electoratului care și-a exprimat astfel nemulțumirea față de clasa politică?!”.  Acest lucru are un efect electoral negativ asupra lui Călin Georgescu, influențând indirect opinia publică printr-o prezentare subiectivă a faptelor. Postarea, având o rază de cuprindere de 500.000-1.000.000 de persoane, conform datelor din Ad Library, și o cheltuială de peste 100 RON, constituie propagandă electorală, încălcând prevederile legale.  Contactul SC INDISCRET MEDIA SRL este indiscretinoltenia@gmail.com și +40251522011.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
